subject: Re: [junit] Contribution idea: assertions that directly support Java 8's Optional
msgSnippet: Mark, Thanks for your mail.  Your idea sounds intriguing.  However, it seems that assertEquals(Optional.none(), x) or assertEquals(Optional.of(y), x) would
messageBody:
Mark,

Thanks for your mail.  Your idea sounds intriguing.  However, it seems that assertEquals(Optional.none(), x) or assertEquals(Optional.of(y), x) would provide most of the benefit, wouldn't they?

   David

On Sun, Oct 4, 2015 at 1:55 PM, Mark Silvis masilvis22@... [junit] <junit@yahoogroups.com> wrote:
 

I would like to contribute to JUnit, and I think I have a good idea for a feature. I’ve found that it would be nice to have assertions that explicitly supported Java 8’s Optional class. I’m thinking something along the lines of assertEmpty() and assertPresent(). Would such an addition be welcomed?

Thanks,
Mark
